intro: Trollius medius, commonly known as the common globeflower, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Trollius medius thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
